001package squidpony.squidgrid.mapping;
002
003import squidpony.ArrayTools;
004import squidpony.squidai.DijkstraMap;
005import squidpony.squidgrid.Measurement;
006import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.DungeonBoneGen;
007import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.TilesetType;
008import squidpony.squidmath.Coord;
009import squidpony.squidmath.GreasedRegion;
010import squidpony.squidmath.IRNG;
011import squidpony.squidmath.OrderedSet;
012import squidpony.squidmath.PoissonDisk;
013import squidpony.squidmath.StatefulRNG;
014
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.EnumMap;
018
019/**
020 * A good way to create a more-complete dungeon, layering different effects and modifications on top of a dungeon
021 * produced by DungeonBoneGen or another dungeon without such effects. Unlike DungeonGenerator, this class uses
022 * environment information for the dungeons it is given (or quickly generates such information if using DungeonBoneGen),
023 * and uses that information to only place effects like grass or water where you specify, like "only in caves", or
024 * "doors should never be in caves". Ensures only connected regions of the map are used by filling unreachable areas
025 * with walls, and can find far-apart staircase positions if generate() is used or can keep existing staircases in a map
026 * if generateRespectingStairs() is used.
027 * <br>
028 * The main technique for using this is simple: Construct a DungeonGenerator, usually with the desired width and height,
029 * then call any feature adding methods that you want in the dungeon, like addWater(), addTraps, addGrass(), or
030 * addDoors(). All of these methods except addDoors() take an int argument that corresponds to a constant in this class,
031 * CAVE, CORRIDOR, or ROOM, or ALL, and they will only cause the requested feature to show up in that environment. Some
032 * of these take different parameters, like addDoors() which needs to know if it should check openings that are two
033 * cells wide to add a door and a wall to, or whether it should only add doors to single-cell openings. In the case of
034 * addDoors(), it doesn't take an environment argument since doors almost always are between environments (rooms and
035 * corridors), so placing them only within one or the other doesn't make sense. This class, unlike the normal
036 * DungeonGenerator, also has an addLake() method, which, like addDoors(), doesn't take an environment parameter. It can
037 * be used to turn a large section of what would otherwise be walls into a lake (of some character for deep lake cells
038 * and some character for shallow lake cells), and corridors that cross the lake become bridges, shown as ':'. It should
039 * be noted that because the lake fills walls, it doesn't change the connectivity of the map unless you can cross the
040 * lake. There's also addMaze(), which does change the connectivity by replacing sections of impassable walls with
041 * twisty, maze-like passages.
042 * <br>
043 * Once you've added any features to the generator's effects list, call generate() to get a char[][] with the
044 * desired dungeon map, using a fixed repertoire of chars to represent the different features, with the exception of the
045 * customization that can be requested from addLake(). If you use the libGDX text-based display module, you can change
046 * what chars are shown by using addSwap() in TextCellFactory. After calling generate(), you can safely get the values
047 * from the stairsUp and stairsDown fields, which are Coords that should be a long distance from each other but
048 * connected in the dungeon. You may want to change those to staircase characters, but there's no requirement to do
049 * anything with them. It's recommended that you keep the resulting char[][] maps in some collection that can be saved,
050 * since SectionDungeonGenerator only stores a temporary copy of the most recently-generated map. The DungeonUtility
051 * field of this class, utility, is a convenient way of accessing the non-static methods in that class, such as
052 * randomFloor(), without needing to create another DungeonUtility (this class creates one, so you don't have to).
053 * Similarly, the Placement field of this class, placement, can be used to find parts of a dungeon that fit certain
054 * qualities for the placement of items, terrain features, or NPCs.
055 * <br>
056 * Example map with a custom-representation lake: https://gist.github.com/tommyettinger/0055075f9de59c452d25
057 * @see DungeonUtility this class exposes a DungeonUtility member; DungeonUtility also has many useful static methods
058 * @see DungeonGenerator for a slightly simpler alternative that does not recognize different sections of dungeon
059 *
060 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
061 * @author Tommy Ettinger - https://github.com/tommyettinger
062 */
063public class SectionDungeonGenerator implements IDungeonGenerator{
064
065    /**
066     * The effects that can be applied to this dungeon. More may be added in future releases.
067     */
068    public enum FillEffect
069    {
070        /**
071         * Water, represented by '~'
072         */
073        WATER,
074        /**
075         * Traps, represented by '^'
076         */
077        TRAPS,
078        /**
079         * Grass, represented by '"'
080         */
081        GRASS,
082        /**
083         * Boulders strewn about open areas, represented by '#' and treated as walls
084         */
085        BOULDERS,
086        /**
087         * Islands of ground, '.', surrounded by shallow water, ',', to place in water at evenly spaced points
088         */
089        ISLANDS
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Constant for features being added to all environment types.
094     */
095    public static final int ALL = 0,
096    /**
097     * Constant for features being added only to rooms.
098     */
099    ROOM = 1,
100    /**
101     * Constant for features being added only to corridors.
102     */
103    CORRIDOR = 2,
104    /**
105     * Constant for features being added only to caves.
106     */
107    CAVE = 3;
108
109    /**
110     * The effects that will be applied when generate is called. Strongly prefer using addWater, addDoors, addTraps,
111     * and addGrass.
112     */
113    public EnumMap<FillEffect, Integer> roomFX, corridorFX, caveFX;
114
115    /**
116     * Percentage of viable positions to fill with doors, represented by '+' for east-to-west connections or '/' for
117     * north-to-south ones; this number will be negative if filling two-cell wide positions but will be made positive
118     * when needed.
119     */
120    public int doorFX;
121    /**
122     * The char to use for deep lake cells.
123     */
124    public char deepLakeGlyph = '~';
125    /**
126     * The char to use for shallow lake cells.
127     */
128    public char shallowLakeGlyph = ',';
129    /**
130     * The approximate percentage of non-room, non-cave, non-edge-of-map wall cells to try to fill with lake. Corridors
131     * that are covered by a lake will become bridges, the glyph ':'.
132     */
133    public int lakeFX;
134    /**
135     * The approximate percentage of non-room, non-cave, non-edge-of-map wall cells to try to fill with maze. Corridors
136     * that are covered by a maze will become part of its layout.
137     */
138    public int mazeFX;
139    public DungeonUtility utility;
140    protected int height, width;
141    public Coord stairsUp, stairsDown;
142    public StatefulRNG rng;
143    protected long rebuildSeed;
144    protected boolean seedFixed;
145    protected int environmentType = 1;
146
147    protected char[][] dungeon;
148    /**
149     * Potentially important if you need to identify specific rooms, corridors, or cave areas in a map.
150     */
151    public RoomFinder finder;
152    /**
153     * Configured by this class after you call generate(), this Placement can be used to locate areas of the dungeon
154     * that fit certain properties, like "out of sight from a door" or "a large flat section of wall that could be used
155     * to place a straight-line object." You can use this as-needed; it does only a small amount of work at the start,
156     * and does the calculations for what areas have certain properties on request.
157     */
158    public Placement placement;
159
160    /**
161     * Get the most recently generated char[][] dungeon out of this class. The
162     * dungeon may be null if generate() or setDungeon() have not been called.
163     * @return a char[][] dungeon, or null.
164     */
165    public char[][] getDungeon() {
166        return dungeon;
167    }
168    /**
169     * Get the most recently generated char[][] dungeon out of this class without any chars other than '#' or '.', for
170     * walls and floors respectively. The dungeon may be null if generate() or setDungeon() have not been called.
171     * @return a char[][] dungeon with only '#' for walls and '.' for floors, or null.
172     */
173    public char[][] getBareDungeon() {
174        return DungeonUtility.simplifyDungeon(dungeon);
175    }
176
177    /**
178     * Change the underlying char[][]; only affects the toString method, and of course getDungeon.
179     * @param dungeon a char[][], probably produced by an earlier call to this class and then modified.
180     */
181    public void setDungeon(char[][] dungeon) {
182        this.dungeon = dungeon;
183        if(dungeon == null)
184        {
185            width = 0;
186            height = 0;
187            return;
188        }
189        width = dungeon.length;
190        if(width > 0)
191            height = dungeon[0].length;
192    }
193
194    /**
195     * Height of the dungeon in cells.
196     * @return Height of the dungeon in cells.
197     */
198    public int getHeight() {
199        return height;
200    }
201
202    /**
203     * Width of the dungeon in cells.
204     * @return Width of the dungeon in cells.
205     */
206    public int getWidth() {
207        return width;
208    }
209
210
211    /**
212     * Make a SectionDungeonGenerator with a LightRNG using a random seed, height 40, and width 40.
213     */
214    public SectionDungeonGenerator()
215    {
216        rng = new StatefulRNG();
217        utility = new DungeonUtility(rng);
218        rebuildSeed = rng.getState();
219        height = 40;
220        width = 40;
221        roomFX = new EnumMap<>(FillEffect.class);
222        corridorFX = new EnumMap<>(FillEffect.class);
223        caveFX = new EnumMap<>(FillEffect.class);
224    }
225
226    /**
227     * Make a SectionDungeonGenerator with the given height and width; the RNG used for generating a dungeon and
228     * adding features will be a LightRNG using a random seed. If width or height is greater than 256, then this will
229     * expand the Coord pool from its 256x256 default so it stores a reference to each Coord that might be used in the
230     * creation of the dungeon (if width and height are 300 and 300, the Coord pool will be 300x300; if width and height
231     * are 500 and 100, the Coord pool will be 500x256 because it won't shrink below the default size of 256x256).
232     * @param width The width of the dungeon in cells
233     * @param height The height of the dungeon in cells
234     */
235    public SectionDungeonGenerator(int width, int height)
236    {
237        this(width, height, new StatefulRNG());
238    }
239
240    /**
241     * Make a SectionDungeonGenerator with the given height, width, and RNG. Use this if you want to seed the RNG. If
242     * width or height is greater than 256, then this will expand the Coord pool from its 256x256 default so it stores a
243     * reference to each Coord that might be used in the creation of the dungeon (if width and height are 300 and 300,
244     * the Coord pool will be 300x300; if width and height are 500 and 100, the Coord pool will be 500x256 because it
245     * won't shrink below the default size of 256x256).
246     * @param width The width of the dungeon in cells
247     * @param height The height of the dungeon in cells
248     * @param rng The RNG to use for all purposes in this class; if it is a StatefulRNG, then it will be used as-is,
249     *            but if it is not a StatefulRNG, a new StatefulRNG will be used, randomly seeded by this parameter
250     */
251    public SectionDungeonGenerator(int width, int height, IRNG rng)
252    {
253        Coord.expandPoolTo(width, height);
254        this.rng = (rng instanceof StatefulRNG) ? (StatefulRNG) rng : new StatefulRNG(rng.nextLong());
255        utility = new DungeonUtility(this.rng);
256        rebuildSeed = this.rng.getState();
257        this.height = height;
258        this.width = width;
259        roomFX = new EnumMap<>(FillEffect.class);
260        corridorFX = new EnumMap<>(FillEffect.class);
261        caveFX = new EnumMap<>(FillEffect.class);
262    }
263
264    /**
265     * Copies all fields from copying and makes a new DungeonGenerator.
266     * @param copying the DungeonGenerator to copy
267     */
268    public SectionDungeonGenerator(SectionDungeonGenerator copying)
269    {
270        rng = new StatefulRNG(copying.rng.getState());
271        utility = new DungeonUtility(rng);
272        rebuildSeed = rng.getState();
273        height = copying.height;
274        width = copying.width;
275        Coord.expandPoolTo(width, height);
276        roomFX = new EnumMap<>(copying.roomFX);
277        corridorFX = new EnumMap<>(copying.corridorFX);
278        caveFX = new EnumMap<>(copying.caveFX);
279        doorFX = copying.doorFX;
280        lakeFX = copying.lakeFX;
281        deepLakeGlyph = copying.deepLakeGlyph;
282        shallowLakeGlyph = copying.shallowLakeGlyph;
283        dungeon = copying.dungeon;
284    }
285
286    /**
287     * Turns the majority of the given percentage of floor cells into water cells, represented by '~'. Water will be
288     * clustered into a random number of pools, with more appearing if needed to fill the percentage.
289     * Each pool will have randomized volume that should fill or get very close to filling the requested
290     * percentage, unless the pools encounter too much tight space. If this DungeonGenerator previously had addWater
291     * called, the latest call will take precedence. No islands will be placed with this variant, but the edge of the
292     * water will be shallow, represented by ','.
293     * @param env the environment to apply this to; uses MixedGenerator's constants, or 0 for "all environments"
294     * @param percentage the percentage of floor cells to fill with water
295     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
296     */
297    public SectionDungeonGenerator addWater(int env, int percentage)
298    {
299        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
300        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
301        switch (env)
302        {
303            case ROOM:
304                roomFX.remove(FillEffect.WATER);
305                roomFX.put(FillEffect.WATER, percentage);
306                break;
307            case CORRIDOR:
308                corridorFX.remove(FillEffect.WATER);
309                corridorFX.put(FillEffect.WATER, percentage);
310                break;
311            case CAVE:
312                caveFX.remove(FillEffect.WATER);
313                caveFX.put(FillEffect.WATER, percentage);
314                break;
315            default:
316                if(roomFX.containsKey(FillEffect.WATER))
317                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.WATER, Math.min(100, roomFX.get(FillEffect.WATER) + percentage));
318                else
319                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.WATER, percentage);
320                if(corridorFX.containsKey(FillEffect.WATER))
321                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.WATER, Math.min(100, corridorFX.get(FillEffect.WATER) + percentage));
322                else
323                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.WATER, percentage);
324                if(caveFX.containsKey(FillEffect.WATER))
325                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.WATER, Math.min(100, caveFX.get(FillEffect.WATER) + percentage));
326                else
327                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.WATER, percentage);
328        }
329        return this;
330    }
331    /**
332     * Turns the majority of the given percentage of floor cells into water cells, represented by '~'. Water will be
333     * clustered into a random number of pools, with more appearing if needed to fill the percentage. Each pool will
334     * have randomized volume that should fill or get very close to filling the requested percentage,
335     * unless the pools encounter too much tight space. If this DungeonGenerator previously had addWater called, the
336     * latest call will take precedence. If islandSpacing is greater than 1, then this will place islands of floor, '.',
337     * surrounded by shallow water, ',', at about the specified distance with Euclidean measurement.
338     * @param env the environment to apply this to; uses MixedGenerator's constants, or 0 for "all environments"
339     * @param percentage the percentage of floor cells to fill with water
340     * @param islandSpacing if greater than 1, islands will be placed randomly this many cells apart.
341     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
342     */
343    public SectionDungeonGenerator addWater(int env, int percentage, int islandSpacing)
344    {
345        addWater(env, percentage);
346
347        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
348        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
349        switch (env) {
350            case ROOM:
351                roomFX.remove(FillEffect.ISLANDS);
352                if(islandSpacing > 1)
353                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.ISLANDS, percentage);
354                break;
355            case CORRIDOR:
356                corridorFX.remove(FillEffect.ISLANDS);
357                if(islandSpacing > 1)
358                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.ISLANDS, percentage);
359                break;
360            case CAVE:
361                caveFX.remove(FillEffect.ISLANDS);
362                if(islandSpacing > 1)
363                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.ISLANDS, percentage);
364                break;
365            default:
366                roomFX.remove(FillEffect.ISLANDS);
367                if(islandSpacing > 1)
368                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.ISLANDS, percentage);
369                corridorFX.remove(FillEffect.ISLANDS);
370                if(islandSpacing > 1)
371                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.ISLANDS, percentage);
372                caveFX.remove(FillEffect.ISLANDS);
373                if(islandSpacing > 1)
374                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.ISLANDS, percentage);
375        }
376
377        return this;
378    }
379
380    /**
381     * Turns the majority of the given percentage of floor cells into grass cells, represented by '"'. Grass will be
382     * clustered into a random number of patches, with more appearing if needed to fill the percentage. Each area will
383     * have randomized volume that should fill or get very close to filling (two thirds of) the requested percentage,
384     * unless the patches encounter too much tight space. If this DungeonGenerator previously had addGrass called, the
385     * latest call will take precedence.
386     * @param env the environment to apply this to; uses MixedGenerator's constants, or 0 for "all environments"
387     * @param percentage the percentage of floor cells to fill with grass; this can vary quite a lot. It may be
388     *                   difficult to fill very high (over 66%) percentages of map with grass, though you can do this by
389     *                   giving a percentage of between 100 and 150.
390     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
391     */
392    public SectionDungeonGenerator addGrass(int env, int percentage)
393    {
394        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
395        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
396        switch (env)
397        {
398            case ROOM:
399                roomFX.remove(FillEffect.GRASS);
400                roomFX.put(FillEffect.GRASS, percentage);
401                break;
402            case CORRIDOR:
403                corridorFX.remove(FillEffect.GRASS);
404                corridorFX.put(FillEffect.GRASS, percentage);
405                break;
406            case CAVE:
407                caveFX.remove(FillEffect.GRASS);
408                caveFX.put(FillEffect.GRASS, percentage);
409                break;
410            default:
411                if(roomFX.containsKey(FillEffect.GRASS))
412                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.GRASS, Math.min(100, roomFX.get(FillEffect.GRASS) + percentage));
413                else
414                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.GRASS, percentage);
415                if(corridorFX.containsKey(FillEffect.GRASS))
416                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.GRASS, Math.min(100, corridorFX.get(FillEffect.GRASS) + percentage));
417                else
418                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.GRASS, percentage);
419                if(caveFX.containsKey(FillEffect.GRASS))
420                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.GRASS, Math.min(100, caveFX.get(FillEffect.GRASS) + percentage));
421                else
422                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.GRASS, percentage);
423        }
424        return this;
425    }
426    /**
427     * Turns the given percentage of floor cells not already adjacent to walls into wall cells, represented by '#'.
428     * If this DungeonGenerator previously had addBoulders called, the latest call will take precedence.
429     * @param env the environment to apply this to; uses MixedGenerator's constants, or 0 for "all environments"
430     * @param percentage the percentage of floor cells not adjacent to walls to fill with boulders.
431     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
432     */
433    public SectionDungeonGenerator addBoulders(int env, int percentage)
434    {
435        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
436        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
437        switch (env)
438        {
439            case ROOM:
440                roomFX.remove(FillEffect.BOULDERS);
441                roomFX.put(FillEffect.BOULDERS, percentage);
442                break;
443            case CORRIDOR:
444                corridorFX.remove(FillEffect.BOULDERS);
445                corridorFX.put(FillEffect.BOULDERS, percentage);
446                break;
447            case CAVE:
448                caveFX.remove(FillEffect.BOULDERS);
449                caveFX.put(FillEffect.BOULDERS, percentage);
450                break;
451            default:
452                if(roomFX.containsKey(FillEffect.BOULDERS))
453                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.BOULDERS, Math.min(100, roomFX.get(FillEffect.BOULDERS) + percentage));
454                else
455                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.BOULDERS, percentage);
456                if(corridorFX.containsKey(FillEffect.BOULDERS))
457                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.BOULDERS, Math.min(100, corridorFX.get(FillEffect.BOULDERS) + percentage));
458                else
459                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.BOULDERS, percentage);
460                if(caveFX.containsKey(FillEffect.BOULDERS))
461                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.BOULDERS, Math.min(100, caveFX.get(FillEffect.BOULDERS) + percentage));
462                else
463                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.BOULDERS, percentage);
464        }
465        return this;
466    }
467    /**
468     * Turns the given percentage of viable doorways into doors, represented by '+' for doors that allow travel along
469     * the x-axis and '/' for doors that allow travel along the y-axis. If doubleDoors is true,
470     * 2-cell-wide openings will be considered viable doorways and will fill one cell with a wall, the other a door.
471     * If this DungeonGenerator previously had addDoors called, the latest call will take precedence.
472     * @param percentage the percentage of valid openings to corridors to fill with doors; should be between 10 and
473     *                   20 if you want doors to appear more than a few times, but not fill every possible opening.
474     * @param doubleDoors true if you want two-cell-wide openings to receive a door and a wall; false if only
475     *                    one-cell-wide openings should receive doors. Usually, this should be true.
476     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
477     */
478    public SectionDungeonGenerator addDoors(int percentage, boolean doubleDoors)
479    {
480        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
481        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
482        if(doubleDoors) percentage *= -1;
483        doorFX = percentage;
484        return this;
485    }
486
487    /**
488     * Instructs the generator to add a winding section of corridors into a large area that can be filled without
489     * overwriting rooms, caves, or the edge of the map; wall cells will become either '#' or '.' and corridors will be
490     * overwritten. If the percentage is too high (40% is probably too high to adequately fill), this will fill less than
491     * the requested percentage rather than fill multiple mazes.
492     * @param percentage The percentage of non-room, non-cave, non-edge-of-map wall cells to try to fill with maze.
493     * @return this for chaining
494     */
495    public SectionDungeonGenerator addMaze(int percentage)
496    {
497
498        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
499        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
500        mazeFX = percentage;
501        return this;
502    }
503
504    /**
505     * Instructs the generator to add a lake (here, of water) into a large area that can be filled without overwriting
506     * rooms, caves, or the edge of the map; wall cells will become the deep lake glyph (here, '~'), unless they are
507     * close to an existing room or cave, in which case they become the shallow lake glyph (here, ','), and corridors
508     * that are "covered" by a lake will become bridges, the glyph ':'. If the percentage is too high (40% is probably
509     * too high to adequately fill), this will fill less than the requested percentage rather than fill multiple lakes.
510     * @param percentage The percentage of non-room, non-cave, non-edge-of-map wall cells to try to fill with lake.
511     * @return this for chaining
512     */
513    public SectionDungeonGenerator addLake(int percentage)
514    {
515        return addLake(percentage, '~', ',');
516    }
517
518    /**
519     * Instructs the generator to add a lake into a large area that can be filled without overwriting rooms, caves, or
520     * the edge of the map; wall cells will become the char deepLake, unless they are close to an existing room or cave,
521     * in which case they become the char shallowLake, and corridors that are "covered" by a lake will become bridges,
522     * the glyph ':'. If the percentage is too high (40% is probably too high to adequately fill), this will fill less
523     * than the requested percentage rather than fill multiple lakes.
524     * @param percentage The percentage of non-room, non-cave, non-edge-of-map wall cells to try to fill with lake.
525     * @param deepLake the char to use for deep lake cells, such as '~'
526     * @param shallowLake the char to use for shallow lake cells, such as ','
527     * @return this for chaining
528     */
529    public SectionDungeonGenerator addLake(int percentage, char deepLake, char shallowLake)
530    {
531        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
532        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
533        lakeFX = percentage;
534        deepLakeGlyph = deepLake;
535        shallowLakeGlyph = shallowLake;
536        return this;
537    }
538
539    /**
540     * Turns the given percentage of open area floor cells into trap cells, represented by '^'. Corridors that have no
541     * possible way to move around a trap will not receive traps, ever. If this DungeonGenerator previously had
542     * addTraps called, the latest call will take precedence.
543     * @param env the environment to apply this to; uses MixedGenerator's constants, or 0 for "all environments"
544     * @param percentage the percentage of valid cells to fill with traps; should be no higher than 5 unless
545     *                   the dungeon floor is meant to be a kill screen or minefield.
546     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
547     */
548    public SectionDungeonGenerator addTraps(int env, int percentage)
549    {
550        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
551        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
552        switch (env)
553        {
554            case ROOM:
555                roomFX.remove(FillEffect.TRAPS);
556                roomFX.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, percentage);
557                break;
558            case CORRIDOR:
559                corridorFX.remove(FillEffect.TRAPS);
560                corridorFX.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, percentage);
561                break;
562            case CAVE:
563                caveFX.remove(FillEffect.TRAPS);
564                caveFX.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, percentage);
565                break;
566            default:
567                if(roomFX.containsKey(FillEffect.TRAPS))
568                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, Math.min(100, roomFX.get(FillEffect.TRAPS) + percentage));
569                else
570                    roomFX.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, percentage);
571                if(corridorFX.containsKey(FillEffect.TRAPS))
572                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, Math.min(100, corridorFX.get(FillEffect.TRAPS) + percentage));
573                else
574                    corridorFX.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, percentage);
575                if(caveFX.containsKey(FillEffect.TRAPS))
576                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, Math.min(100, caveFX.get(FillEffect.TRAPS) + percentage));
577                else
578                    caveFX.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, percentage);
579        }
580        return this;
581    }
582
583    /**
584     * Removes any door, water, or trap insertion effects that this DungeonGenerator would put in future dungeons.
585     * @return this DungeonGenerator, with all effects removed. Can be chained.
586     */
587    public SectionDungeonGenerator clearEffects()
588    {
589        roomFX.clear();
590        corridorFX.clear();
591        caveFX.clear();
592        lakeFX = 0;
593        mazeFX = 0;
594        doorFX = 0;
595        return this;
596    }
597
598    protected OrderedSet<Coord> removeAdjacent(OrderedSet<Coord> coll, Coord pt)
599    {
600        for(Coord temp : new Coord[]{Coord.get(pt.x + 1, pt.y), Coord.get(pt.x - 1, pt.y),
601                Coord.get(pt.x, pt.y + 1), Coord.get(pt.x, pt.y - 1)})
602        {
603            coll.remove(temp);
604        }
605
606        return coll;
607    }
608    protected OrderedSet<Coord> removeAdjacent(OrderedSet<Coord> coll, Coord pt1, Coord pt2)
609    {
610
611        for(Coord temp : new Coord[]{Coord.get(pt1.x + 1, pt1.y), Coord.get(pt1.x - 1, pt1.y),
612                Coord.get(pt1.x, pt1.y + 1), Coord.get(pt1.x, pt1.y - 1),
613                Coord.get(pt2.x + 1, pt2.y), Coord.get(pt2.x - 1, pt2.y),
614                Coord.get(pt2.x, pt2.y + 1), Coord.get(pt2.x, pt2.y - 1),})
615        {
616            if(!(temp.x == pt1.x && temp.y == pt1.y) && !(temp.x == pt2.x && temp.y == pt2.y))
617                coll.remove(temp);
618        }
619
620        return coll;
621    }
622    protected OrderedSet<Coord> removeNearby(OrderedSet<Coord> coll, char[][] disallowed)
623    {
624        if(coll == null || disallowed == null || disallowed.length == 0 || disallowed[0].length == 0)
625            return new OrderedSet<>();
626        OrderedSet<Coord> next = new OrderedSet<>(coll.size());
627        int width = disallowed.length, height = disallowed[0].length;
628        COORD_WISE:
629        for(Coord c : coll)
630        {
631            for (int x = Math.max(0, c.x - 1); x <= Math.min(width - 1, c.x + 1); x++) {
632
633                for (int y = Math.max(0, c.y - 1); y <= Math.min(height - 1, c.y + 1); y++) {
634                    if(disallowed[x][y] != '#')
635                        continue COORD_WISE;
636                }
637            }
638            next.add(c);
639        }
640
641        return next;
642    }
643
644
645    protected OrderedSet<Coord> viableDoorways(boolean doubleDoors, char[][] map, char[][] allCaves,
646                                                  char[][] allCorridors)
647    {
648        OrderedSet<Coord> doors = new OrderedSet<>();
649        OrderedSet<Coord> blocked = new OrderedSet<>(4);
650        DijkstraMap dm = new DijkstraMap(map, Measurement.EUCLIDEAN);
651        for(int x = 1; x < map.length - 1; x++) {
652            for (int y = 1; y < map[x].length - 1; y++) {
653                if(map[x][y] == '#' || allCorridors[x][y] != '#')
654                    continue;
655                if (doubleDoors) {
656                    if (x >= map.length - 2 || y >= map[x].length - 2)
657                        continue;
658                    else {
659                        if (map[x+1][y] != '#' &&
660                                map[x + 2][y] == '#' && map[x - 1][y] == '#'
661                                && map[x][y + 1] != '#' && map[x][y - 1] != '#'
662                                && map[x+1][y + 1] != '#' && map[x+1][y - 1] != '#') {
663                            if (map[x + 2][y + 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x + 2][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
664                                dm.resetMap();
665                                dm.clearGoals();
666                                dm.setGoal(x, y+1);
667                                blocked.clear();
668                                blocked.add(Coord.get(x, y));
669                                blocked.add(Coord.get(x + 1, y));
670                                dm.partialScan(null, 16, blocked);
671                                if(dm.gradientMap[x][y-1] < DijkstraMap.FLOOR)
672                                    continue;
673                                doors.add(Coord.get(x, y));
674                                doors.add(Coord.get(x + 1, y));
675                                doors = removeAdjacent(doors, Coord.get(x, y), Coord.get(x + 1, y));
676                                continue;
677                            }
678                        } else if (map[x][y+1] != '#' &&
679                                map[x][y + 2] == '#' && map[x][y - 1] == '#'
680                                && map[x + 1][y] != '#' && map[x - 1][y] != '#'
681                                && map[x + 1][y+1] != '#' && map[x - 1][y+1] != '#') {
682                            if (map[x + 1][y + 2] != '#' || map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 2] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
683                                dm.resetMap();
684                                dm.clearGoals();
685                                dm.setGoal(x+1, y);
686                                blocked.clear();
687                                blocked.add(Coord.get(x, y));
688                                blocked.add(Coord.get(x, y+1));
689                                dm.partialScan(null, 16, blocked);
690                                if(dm.gradientMap[x-1][y] < DijkstraMap.FLOOR)
691                                    continue;
692                                doors.add(Coord.get(x, y));
693                                doors.add(Coord.get(x, y+1));
694                                doors = removeAdjacent(doors, Coord.get(x, y), Coord.get(x, y + 1));
695                                continue;
696                            }
697                        }
698                    }
699                }
700                if (map[x + 1][y] == '#' && map[x - 1][y] == '#' && map[x][y + 1] != '#' && map[x][y - 1] != '#') {
701                    if (map[x + 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
702                        dm.resetMap();
703                        dm.clearGoals();
704                        dm.setGoal(x, y+1);
705                        blocked.clear();
706                        blocked.add(Coord.get(x, y));
707                        dm.partialScan(null, 16, blocked);
708                        if(dm.gradientMap[x][y-1] < DijkstraMap.FLOOR)
709                            continue;
710                        doors.add(Coord.get(x, y));
711                        doors = removeAdjacent(doors, Coord.get(x, y));
712                    }
713                } else if (map[x][y + 1] == '#' && map[x][y - 1] == '#' && map[x + 1][y] != '#' && map[x - 1][y] != '#') {
714                    if (map[x + 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
715                        dm.resetMap();
716                        dm.clearGoals();
717                        dm.setGoal(x+1, y);
718                        blocked.clear();
719                        blocked.add(Coord.get(x, y));
720                        dm.partialScan(null, 16, blocked);
721                        if(dm.gradientMap[x-1][y] < DijkstraMap.FLOOR)
722                            continue;
723                        doors.add(Coord.get(x, y));
724                        doors = removeAdjacent(doors, Coord.get(x, y));
725                    }
726                }
727
728            }
729        }
730
731        return removeNearby(doors, allCaves);
732    }
733
734    /**
735     * Generate a char[][] dungeon using TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON; this produces a dungeon appropriate for a level
736     * of ruins or a partially constructed dungeon. This uses '#' for walls, '.' for floors, '~' for deep water, ',' for
737     * shallow water, '^' for traps, '+' for doors that provide horizontal passage, and '/' for doors that provide
738     * vertical passage. Use the addDoors, addWater, addGrass, and addTraps methods of this class to request these in
739     * the generated map.
740     * Also sets the fields stairsUp and stairsDown to two randomly chosen, distant, connected, walkable cells.
741     * @return a char[][] dungeon
742     */
743    public char[][] generate() {
744        return generate(TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON);
745    }
746
747    /**
748     * Generate a char[][] dungeon given a TilesetType; the comments in that class provide some opinions on what
749     * each TilesetType value could be used for in a game. This uses '#' for walls, '.' for floors, '~' for deep water,
750     * ',' for shallow water, '^' for traps, '+' for doors that provide horizontal passage, and '/' for doors that
751     * provide vertical passage. Use the addDoors, addWater, addGrass, and addTraps methods of this class to request
752     * these in the generated map.
753     * Also sets the fields stairsUp and stairsDown to two randomly chosen, distant, connected, walkable cells.
754     * @see TilesetType
755     * @param kind a TilesetType enum value, such as TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON
756     * @return a char[][] dungeon
757     */
758    public char[][] generate(TilesetType kind)
759    {
760        rebuildSeed = rng.getState();
761        environmentType = kind.environment();
762        DungeonBoneGen gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
763        char[][] map = DungeonUtility.wallWrap(gen.generate(kind, width, height));
764
765        seedFixed = false;
766        DijkstraMap dijkstra = new DijkstraMap(map);
767        int frustrated = 0;
768        do {
769            dijkstra.clearGoals();
770            stairsUp = utility.randomFloor(map);
771            dijkstra.setGoal(stairsUp);
772            dijkstra.scan(null, null);
773            frustrated++;
774        }while (dijkstra.getMappedCount() < width + height && frustrated < 15);
775        double maxDijkstra = 0.0;
776        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
777            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
778                if(dijkstra.gradientMap[i][j] >= DijkstraMap.FLOOR) {
779                    map[i][j] = '#';
780                }
781                else if(dijkstra.gradientMap[i][j] > maxDijkstra) {
782                    maxDijkstra = dijkstra.gradientMap[i][j];
783                }
784            }
785        }
786        stairsDown = new GreasedRegion(dijkstra.gradientMap, maxDijkstra * 0.7,
787                DijkstraMap.FLOOR).singleRandom(rng);
788        finder = new RoomFinder(map, environmentType);
789        return innerGenerate();
790    }
791
792    /**
793     * Generate a char[][] dungeon with extra features given a baseDungeon that has already been generated and an
794     * environment as an int[][], which can often be obtained from MixedGenerator or classes that use it, like
795     * SerpentMapGenerator, with their getEnvironment method.
796     * Typically, you want to call generate with a TilesetType or no argument for the easiest generation; this method
797     * is meant for adding features like water and doors to existing maps while avoiding placing incongruous features in
798     * areas where they don't fit, like a door in a cave or moss in a room.
799     * This uses '#' for walls, '.' for floors, '~' for deep water, ',' for shallow water, '^' for traps, '+' for doors
800     * that provide horizontal passage, and '/' for doors that provide vertical passage.
801     * Use the addDoors, addWater, addGrass, and addTraps methods of this class to request these in the generated map.
802     * Also sets the fields stairsUp and stairsDown to two randomly chosen, distant, connected, walkable cells.
803     * <br>
804     * Special behavior here: If tab characters are present in the 2D char array, they will be replaced with '.' in the
805     * final dungeon, but will also be tried first as valid staircase locations (with a high distance possible to travel
806     * away from the starting staircase). If no tab characters are present this will search for '.' floors to place
807     * stairs on, as normal. This tab-first behavior is useful in conjunction with some methods that establish a good
808     * path in an existing dungeon; an example is {@code DungeonUtility.ensurePath(dungeon, rng, '\t', '#');} then
809     * passing dungeon (which that code modifies) in as baseDungeon to this method. Because tabs will always be replaced
810     * by floors ('.'), this considers any tabs that overlap with what the environment considers a wall (cave wall, room
811     * wall, corridor wall, or untouched) to really refer to a corridor floor, but doesn't reconsider tabs that overlap
812     * with floors already (it keeps the state of actual room, cave, and corridor floors). This is useful so you only
813     * have to call ensurePath or a similar method on the 2D char array and can leave the 2D int array alone.
814     * @param baseDungeon a pre-made dungeon consisting of '#' for walls and '.' for floors; may be modified in-place
815     * @param environment stores whether a cell is room, corridor, or cave; getEnvironment() typically gives this
816     * @return a char[][] dungeon
817     */
818    public char[][] generate(char[][] baseDungeon, int[][] environment)
819    {
820        if(!seedFixed)
821        {
822            rebuildSeed = rng.getState();
823        }
824        seedFixed = false;
825        char[][] map = DungeonUtility.wallWrap(baseDungeon);
826        width = map.length;
827        height = map[0].length;
828        int[][] env2 = new int[width][height];
829        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
830            System.arraycopy(environment[x], 0, env2[x], 0, height);
831        }
832
833        DijkstraMap dijkstra = new DijkstraMap(map);
834        int frustrated = 0;
835        do {
836            dijkstra.clearGoals();
837            stairsUp = utility.randomMatchingTile(map, '\t');
838            if(stairsUp == null) {
839                stairsUp = utility.randomFloor(map);
840                if (stairsUp == null) {
841                    frustrated++;
842                    continue;
843                }
844            }
845            dijkstra.setGoal(stairsUp);
846            dijkstra.scan(null, null);
847            frustrated++;
848        }while (dijkstra.getMappedCount() < width + height && frustrated < 8);
849        if(frustrated >= 8)
850        {
851            return generate();
852        }
853        double maxDijkstra = 0.0;
854        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
855            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
856                if(dijkstra.gradientMap[i][j] >= DijkstraMap.FLOOR) {
857                    map[i][j] = '#';
858                    env2[i][j] = DungeonUtility.UNTOUCHED;
859                }
860                else if(dijkstra.gradientMap[i][j] > maxDijkstra) {
861                    maxDijkstra = dijkstra.gradientMap[i][j];
862                }
863                if (map[i][j] == '\t') {
864                    map[i][j] = '.';
865                    if((env2[i][j] & 1) == 0) // environment is a wall here
866                        env2[i][j] = DungeonUtility.CORRIDOR_FLOOR;
867                }
868            }
869        }
870        if(maxDijkstra < 16)
871            return generate(baseDungeon, environment);
872        stairsDown = new GreasedRegion(dijkstra.gradientMap, maxDijkstra * 0.7,
873                DijkstraMap.FLOOR).singleRandom(rng);
874        finder = new RoomFinder(map, env2);
875        return innerGenerate();
876    }
877
878    /**
879     * Generate a char[][] dungeon with extra features given a baseDungeon that has already been generated, with
880     * staircases represented by greater than and less than signs, and an environment as an int[][], which can often be
881     * obtained from MixedGenerator or classes that use it, like SerpentMapGenerator, with their getEnvironment method.
882     * Typically, you want to call generate with a TilesetType or no argument for the easiest generation; this method
883     * is meant for adding features like water and doors to existing maps while avoiding placing incongruous features in
884     * areas where they don't fit, like a door in a cave or moss in a room.
885     * This uses '#' for walls, '.' for floors, '~' for deep water, ',' for shallow water, '^' for traps, '+' for doors
886     * that provide horizontal passage, and '/' for doors that provide vertical passage.
887     * Use the addDoors, addWater, addGrass, and addTraps methods of this class to request these in the generated map.
888     * Also sets the fields stairsUp and stairsDown to null, and expects stairs to be already handled.
889     * @param baseDungeon a pre-made dungeon consisting of '#' for walls and '.' for floors, with stairs already in;
890     *                    may be modified in-place
891     * @param environment stores whether a cell is room, corridor, or cave; getEnvironment() typically gives this
892     * @return a char[][] dungeon
893     */
894    public char[][] generateRespectingStairs(char[][] baseDungeon, int[][] environment) {
895        if(!seedFixed)
896        {
897            rebuildSeed = rng.getState();
898        }
899        seedFixed = false;
900        char[][] map = DungeonUtility.wallWrap(baseDungeon);
901        int[][] env2 = new int[width][height];
902        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
903            System.arraycopy(environment[x], 0, env2[x], 0, height);
904        }
905        DijkstraMap dijkstra = new DijkstraMap(map);
906        stairsUp = null;
907        stairsDown = null;
908
909        dijkstra.clearGoals();
910        ArrayList<Coord> stairs = DungeonUtility.allMatching(map, '<', '>');
911        for (int j = 0; j < stairs.size(); j++) {
912            dijkstra.setGoal(stairs.get(j));
913        }
914        dijkstra.scan(null, null);
915        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
916            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
917                if (dijkstra.gradientMap[i][j] >= DijkstraMap.FLOOR) {
918                    map[i][j] = '#';
919                    env2[i][j] = DungeonUtility.UNTOUCHED;
920                }
921            }
922        }
923        finder = new RoomFinder(map, env2);
924        return innerGenerate();
925    }
926
927
928
929    protected char[][] innerGenerate() {
930        dungeon = ArrayTools.fill('#', width, height);
931        ArrayList<char[][]> rm = finder.findRooms(),
932                cr = finder.findCorridors(),
933                cv = finder.findCaves();
934        char[][] roomMap = innerGenerate(RoomFinder.merge(rm, width, height), roomFX),
935                allCorridors = RoomFinder.merge(cr, width, height),
936                corridorMap = innerGenerate(allCorridors, corridorFX),
937                allCaves = RoomFinder.merge(cv, width, height),
938                caveMap = innerGenerate(allCaves, caveFX),
939                doorMap;
940        char[][][] lakesAndMazes = makeLake(rm, cv);
941        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
942            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
943                if (corridorMap[x][y] != '#' && lakesAndMazes[0][x][y] != '#')
944                    dungeon[x][y] = ':';
945                else if (roomMap[x][y] != '#')
946                    dungeon[x][y] = roomMap[x][y];
947                else if (lakesAndMazes[1][x][y] != '#') {
948                    dungeon[x][y] = lakesAndMazes[1][x][y];
949                    finder.environment[x][y] = DungeonUtility.CORRIDOR_FLOOR;
950                } else if (corridorMap[x][y] != '#')
951                    dungeon[x][y] = corridorMap[x][y];
952                else if (caveMap[x][y] != '#')
953                    dungeon[x][y] = caveMap[x][y];
954                else if (lakesAndMazes[0][x][y] != '#') {
955                    dungeon[x][y] = lakesAndMazes[0][x][y];
956                    finder.environment[x][y] = DungeonUtility.CAVE_FLOOR;
957                }
958            }
959        }
960        finder = new RoomFinder(dungeon, finder.environment);
961        rm = finder.findRooms();
962        cr = finder.findCorridors();
963        cv = finder.findCaves();
964        cv.add(lakesAndMazes[0]);
965        allCaves = RoomFinder.merge(cv, width, height);
966        doorMap = makeDoors(rm, cr, allCaves, allCorridors);
967        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
968            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
969                if (doorMap[x][y] == '+' || doorMap[x][y] == '/')
970                    dungeon[x][y] = doorMap[x][y];
971                else if (doorMap[x][y] == '*')
972                    dungeon[x][y] = '#';
973
974            }
975        }
976        placement = new Placement(finder);
977        return dungeon;
978
979    }
980    protected char[][] makeDoors(ArrayList<char[][]> rooms, ArrayList<char[][]> corridors, char[][] allCaves,
981                               char[][] allCorridors)
982    {
983        char[][] map = new char[width][height];
984        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
985            Arrays.fill(map[x], '#');
986        }
987        if(doorFX == 0 || (rooms.isEmpty() && corridors.isEmpty()))
988            return map;
989        boolean doubleDoors = false;
990        int doorFill = doorFX;
991        if(doorFill < 0)
992        {
993            doubleDoors = true;
994            doorFill *= -1;
995        }
996        ArrayList<char[][]> fused = new ArrayList<>(rooms.size() + corridors.size());
997        fused.addAll(rooms);
998        fused.addAll(corridors);
999
1000        map = RoomFinder.merge(fused, width, height);
1001
1002        OrderedSet<Coord> doorways = viableDoorways(doubleDoors, map, allCaves, allCorridors);
1003
1004
1005        int total = doorways.size() * doorFill / 100;
1006
1007        BigLoop:
1008        for(int i = 0; i < total; i++) {
1009            Coord entry = rng.getRandomElement(doorways);
1010            if (map[entry.x][entry.y] == '<' || map[entry.x][entry.y] == '>')
1011                continue;
1012            if (map[entry.x - 1][entry.y] != '#' && map[entry.x + 1][entry.y] != '#' &&
1013                    map[entry.x - 1][entry.y] != '*' && map[entry.x + 1][entry.y] != '*') {
1014                map[entry.x][entry.y] = '+';
1015            } else {
1016                map[entry.x][entry.y] = '/';
1017            }
1018            Coord[] adj = new Coord[]{Coord.get(entry.x + 1, entry.y), Coord.get(entry.x - 1, entry.y),
1019                    Coord.get(entry.x, entry.y + 1), Coord.get(entry.x, entry.y - 1)};
1020            for (Coord near : adj) {
1021                if (doorways.contains(near)) {
1022                    map[near.x][near.y] = '*';
1023                    doorways.remove(near);
1024                    doorways.remove(entry);
1025                    i++;
1026                    continue BigLoop;
1027                }
1028            }
1029            doorways.remove(entry);
1030        }
1031        return map;
1032
1033    }
1034    protected char[][][] makeLake(ArrayList<char[][]> rooms, ArrayList<char[][]> caves)
1035    {
1036        char[][][] maps = new char[2][width][height];
1037        char[][] fusedMap;
1038        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1039            Arrays.fill(maps[0][x], '#');
1040            Arrays.fill(maps[1][x], '#');
1041        }
1042        if((lakeFX == 0 && mazeFX == 0) || (rooms.isEmpty() && caves.isEmpty()))
1043            return maps;
1044        int lakeFill = lakeFX, mazeFill = mazeFX;
1045        if(lakeFX + mazeFX > 100)
1046        {
1047            lakeFill -= (lakeFX + mazeFX - 100) / 2;
1048            mazeFill -= (lakeFX + mazeFX - 99) / 2;
1049        }
1050
1051        ArrayList<char[][]> fused = new ArrayList<>(rooms.size() + caves.size());
1052        fused.addAll(rooms);
1053        fused.addAll(caves);
1054
1055        fusedMap = RoomFinder.merge(fused, width, height);
1056        GreasedRegion limit = new GreasedRegion(width, height).insertRectangle(1, 1, width - 2, height - 2),
1057                potential = new GreasedRegion(fusedMap, '#').and(limit),
1058                flooded, chosen, tmp = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
1059        int ctr = potential.size(), potentialMazeSize = ctr * mazeFill / 100, potentialLakeSize = ctr * lakeFill / 100;
1060        ArrayList<GreasedRegion> viable;
1061        int minSize;
1062        Coord center;
1063        boolean[][] deep;
1064        if(potentialMazeSize > 0) {
1065            viable = potential.split();
1066            if (viable.isEmpty())
1067                return maps;
1068
1069            chosen = viable.get(0);
1070            minSize = chosen.size();
1071            for (GreasedRegion sa : viable) {
1072                int sz = sa.size();
1073                if (sz > minSize) {
1074                    chosen = sa;
1075                    minSize = sz;
1076                }
1077            }
1078            PacMazeGenerator pac = new PacMazeGenerator(width - width % 3, height - height % 3, rng);
1079            char[][] pacMap = ArrayTools.insert(pac.generate(), ArrayTools.fill('#', width, height), 1, 1);
1080            center = chosen.singleRandom(rng);
1081            flooded = new GreasedRegion(center, width, height).spill(chosen, potentialMazeSize, rng).and(limit);
1082            GreasedRegion pacEnv = new GreasedRegion(pacMap, '.').and(flooded).removeIsolated();
1083            deep = pacEnv.decode();
1084
1085            for (int x = 1; x < width - 1; x++) {
1086                for (int y = 1; y < height - 1; y++) {
1087                    if (deep[x][y])
1088                        maps[1][x][y] = pacMap[x][y];
1089                }
1090            }
1091            finder.corridors.put(pacEnv, new ArrayList<GreasedRegion>());
1092            finder.allCorridors.or(pacEnv);
1093            finder.allFloors.or(pacEnv);
1094            potential.andNot(flooded);
1095        }
1096        if(potentialLakeSize > 0) {
1097            viable = potential.split();
1098            if (viable.isEmpty())
1099                return maps;
1100            chosen = viable.get(0);
1101            minSize = chosen.size();
1102            for (GreasedRegion sa : viable) {
1103                int sz = sa.size();
1104                if (sz > minSize) {
1105                    chosen = sa;
1106                    minSize = sz;
1107                }
1108            }
1109            center = chosen.singleRandom(rng);
1110            flooded = new GreasedRegion(center, width, height).spill(chosen, potentialLakeSize, rng).and(limit);
1111
1112            deep = flooded.decode();
1113            flooded.flood(new GreasedRegion(fusedMap, '.').fringe8way(3), 3).and(limit);
1114
1115            boolean[][] shallow = flooded.decode();
1116
1117            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1118                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1119                    if (deep[x][y])
1120                        maps[0][x][y] = deepLakeGlyph;
1121                    else if (shallow[x][y])
1122                        maps[0][x][y] = shallowLakeGlyph;
1123                }
1124            }
1125            ArrayList<GreasedRegion> change = new ArrayList<>();
1126            for (GreasedRegion room : finder.rooms.keySet()) {
1127                if(flooded.intersects(tmp.remake(room).expand8way()))
1128                    change.add(room);
1129            }
1130            for (GreasedRegion region : change) {
1131                finder.caves.put(region, finder.rooms.remove(region));
1132                finder.allRooms.andNot(region);
1133                finder.allCaves.or(region);
1134            }
1135        }
1136        return maps;
1137    }
1138
1139    protected char[][] innerGenerate(char[][] map, EnumMap<FillEffect, Integer> fx)
1140    {
1141        OrderedSet<Coord> hazards = new OrderedSet<>();
1142        int floorCount = DungeonUtility.countCells(map, '.'),
1143                doorFill = 0,
1144                waterFill = 0,
1145                grassFill = 0,
1146                trapFill = 0,
1147                boulderFill = 0,
1148                islandSpacing = 0;
1149
1150        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.GRASS)) {
1151            grassFill = fx.get(FillEffect.GRASS);
1152        }
1153        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.WATER)) {
1154            waterFill = fx.get(FillEffect.WATER);
1155        }
1156        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.BOULDERS)) {
1157            boulderFill = fx.get(FillEffect.BOULDERS) * floorCount / 100;
1158        }
1159        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.ISLANDS)) {
1160            islandSpacing = fx.get(FillEffect.ISLANDS);
1161        }
1162        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.TRAPS)) {
1163            trapFill = fx.get(FillEffect.TRAPS);
1164        }
1165        if (boulderFill > 0.0) {
1166            /*
1167            short[] floor = pack(map, '.');
1168            short[] viable = retract(floor, 1, width, height, true);
1169            ArrayList<Coord> boulders = randomPortion(viable, boulderFill, rng);
1170            for (Coord boulder : boulders) {
1171                map[boulder.x][boulder.y] = '#';
1172            }
1173            */
1174            Coord[] boulders = new GreasedRegion(map, '.').retract8way(1).randomPortion(rng, boulderFill);
1175            Coord t;
1176            for (int i = 0; i < boulders.length; i++) {
1177                t = boulders[i];
1178                map[t.x][t.y] = '#';
1179            }
1180        }
1181
1182
1183        if(trapFill > 0) {
1184            for (int x = 1; x < map.length - 1; x++) {
1185                for (int y = 1; y < map[x].length - 1; y++) {
1186                    if (map[x][y] == '.') {
1187                        int ctr = 0;
1188                        if (map[x + 1][y] != '#') ++ctr;
1189                        if (map[x - 1][y] != '#') ++ctr;
1190                        if (map[x][y + 1] != '#') ++ctr;
1191                        if (map[x][y - 1] != '#') ++ctr;
1192                        if (map[x + 1][y + 1] != '#') ++ctr;
1193                        if (map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#') ++ctr;
1194                        if (map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#') ++ctr;
1195                        if (map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') ++ctr;
1196                        if (ctr >= 5) hazards.add(Coord.get(x, y));
1197                    }
1198                }
1199            }
1200        }
1201        GreasedRegion floors = new GreasedRegion(map, '.'), working = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
1202        floorCount = floors.size();
1203        float waterRate = waterFill / 100.0f, grassRate = grassFill / 100.0f;
1204        if(waterRate + grassRate > 1.0f)
1205        {
1206            waterRate /= (waterFill + grassFill) / 100.0f;
1207            grassRate /= (waterFill + grassFill) / 100.0f;
1208        }
1209        int targetWater = Math.round(floorCount * waterRate),
1210                targetGrass = Math.round(floorCount * grassRate),
1211                sizeWaterPools = targetWater / rng.between(3, 6),
1212                sizeGrassPools = targetGrass / rng.between(2, 5);
1213
1214        Coord[] scatter;
1215        int remainingWater = targetWater, remainingGrass = targetGrass;
1216        if(targetWater > 0) {
1217            scatter = floors.quasiRandomSeparated(1.0 / 7.0);
1218            rng.shuffleInPlace(scatter);
1219            GreasedRegion allWater = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
1220            for (int i = 0; i < scatter.length; i++) {
1221                if (remainingWater > 5)
1222                {
1223                    if(!floors.contains(scatter[i]))
1224                        continue;
1225                    working.empty().insert(scatter[i]).spill(floors, rng.between(4, Math.min(remainingWater, sizeWaterPools)), rng);
1226
1227                    floors.andNot(working);
1228                    remainingWater -= working.size();
1229                    allWater.addAll(working);
1230                } else
1231                    break;
1232            }
1233
1234            for (Coord pt : allWater) {
1235                hazards.remove(pt);
1236                //obstacles.add(pt);
1237                if (map[pt.x][pt.y] != '<' && map[pt.x][pt.y] != '>')
1238                    map[pt.x][pt.y] = '~';
1239            }
1240            for (Coord pt : allWater) {
1241                if (map[pt.x][pt.y] != '<' && map[pt.x][pt.y] != '>' &&
1242                        (map[pt.x - 1][pt.y] == '.' || map[pt.x + 1][pt.y] == '.' ||
1243                                map[pt.x][pt.y - 1] == '.' || map[pt.x][pt.y + 1] == '.'))
1244                    map[pt.x][pt.y] = ',';
1245            }
1246        }
1247
1248        if(targetGrass > 0) {
1249            scatter = floors.quasiRandomSeparated(1.03/6.7);
1250            rng.shuffleInPlace(scatter);
1251            for (int i = 0; i < scatter.length; i++) {
1252                if (remainingGrass > 5) //remainingGrass >= targetGrass * 0.02 &&
1253                {
1254                    working.empty().insert(scatter[i]).spill(floors, rng.between(4, Math.min(remainingGrass, sizeGrassPools)), rng);
1255                    if (working.isEmpty())
1256                        continue;
1257                    floors.andNot(working);
1258                    remainingGrass -= working.size();
1259                    map = working.inverseMask(map, '"');
1260                } else
1261                    break;
1262            }
1263        }
1264
1265        if(islandSpacing > 1 && targetWater > 0) {
1266            OrderedSet<Coord> islands = PoissonDisk.sampleMap(map, islandSpacing, rng, '#', '.', '"', '+', '/', '^', '<', '>');
1267            for (Coord c : islands) {
1268                map[c.x][c.y] = '.';
1269                if (map[c.x - 1][c.y] != '#' && map[c.x - 1][c.y] != '<' && map[c.x - 1][c.y] != '>')
1270                    map[c.x - 1][c.y] = ',';
1271                if (map[c.x + 1][c.y] != '#' && map[c.x + 1][c.y] != '<' && map[c.x + 1][c.y] != '>')
1272                    map[c.x + 1][c.y] = ',';
1273                if (map[c.x][c.y - 1] != '#' && map[c.x][c.y - 1] != '<' && map[c.x][c.y - 1] != '>')
1274                    map[c.x][c.y - 1] = ',';
1275                if (map[c.x][c.y + 1] != '#' && map[c.x][c.y + 1] != '<' && map[c.x][c.y + 1] != '>')
1276                    map[c.x][c.y + 1] = ',';
1277            }
1278        }
1279
1280        if(trapFill > 0)
1281        {
1282            int total = hazards.size() * trapFill / 100;
1283
1284            for(int i = 0; i < total; i++)
1285            {
1286                Coord entry = rng.getRandomElement(hazards);
1287                if(map[entry.x][entry.y] == '<' || map[entry.x][entry.y] == '>')
1288                    continue;
1289                map[entry.x][entry.y] = '^';
1290                hazards.remove(entry);
1291            }
1292        }
1293
1294        return map;
1295
1296    }
1297
1298    /**
1299     * Gets the seed that can be used to rebuild an identical dungeon to the latest one generated (or the seed that
1300     * will be used to generate the first dungeon if none has been made yet). You can pass the long this returns to
1301     * the setState() method on this class' rng field, which assuming all other calls to generate a dungeon are
1302     * identical, will ensure generate() or generateRespectingStairs() will produce the same dungeon output as the
1303     * dungeon originally generated with the seed this returned.
1304     * <br>
1305     * You can also call getState() on the rng field yourself immediately before generating a dungeon, but this method
1306     * handles some complexities of when the state is actually used to generate a dungeon; since StatefulRNG objects can
1307     * be shared between different classes that use random numbers, the state could change between when you call
1308     * getState() and when this class generates a dungeon. Using getRebuildSeed() eliminates that confusion.
1309     * @return a seed as a long that can be passed to setState() on this class' rng field to recreate a dungeon
1310     */
1311    public long getRebuildSeed() {
1312        return rebuildSeed;
1313    }
1314
1315    /**
1316     * Provides a string representation of the latest generated dungeon.
1317     *
1318     * @return a printable string version of the latest generated dungeon.
1319     */
1320    @Override
1321        public String toString() {
1322        char[][] trans = new char[height][width];
1323        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1324            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1325                trans[y][x] = dungeon[x][y];
1326            }
1327        }
1328        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1329        for (int row = 0; row < height; row++) {
1330            sb.append(trans[row]);
1331            sb.append('\n');
1332        }
1333        return sb.toString();
1334    }
1335
1336}
